reviews.review_text: This restaurant has managed to maintain its exceptional taste over the years, making it a reliable choice for food enthusiasts. I highly recommend trying their apple chicken it's a must-try dish that perfectly balances sweetness and savory flavours.

üü•‚ùå DO NOT VISIT THIS RESTAURANT ‚ùåüü•

‚ùå THIS RESTAURANT DOES NOT PREPARE VEG & NON VEG DISHES SEPARATELY ‚ùå

This review is posted on 15 August 2024.

Being Shravan Month I had ordered Gobi Crispy and clearly asked waiter about veg dishes being prepared separately to which he had confirmed the same that they do prepare separately.

After serving Gobi Crispy I just checked to confirm the pieces to which I found a piece of Chicken Lolipop inside my ordered VEG DISH.

I called the waiter first and asked about the same to which he agreed that it was a chicken piece. Then I called the manager to which he did not even apologize & told me we will prepare another one and serve.

If a customer finds a chicken piece in a veg dish then this clearly states that they don't prepare veg dishes separately.

I did not pay the bill and clearly told the manager that I am going to post this review.

To all those people who are strictly vegan thinking to visit this restaurant, DO NOT VISIT THIS RESTAURANT EVER.

PHOTO ATTACHED FOR REFERENCE.

Abhishek Palace in Ponda is not recommended for dining, whether as a couple or family, due to its uncomfortable ambiance.

Waiting times are long, and the overall dining experience does not justify the expense.

The manager's sarcastic demeanor and lack of proper customer service skills were disappointing.

The cream of chicken soup was excessively sweet and deemed the worst soup ever tasted.

In contrast, the hot and sour manchow soup was better received.

Both the chicken biryani and chicken handi biryani tasted the same, despite being served in different utensils, which was disclosed in advance.

The butter chicken was not impressive, and the naan was ordinary.

While it may be favorable to locals and those in the vicinity, but personally I would not recommend this place at all.

Service was slow, and the presence of numerous mosquitoes further detracted from the dining experience.

It's worth noting that meals are not available here, and the menu mainly consists of Chinese food items.
